member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ChangePendedFlags.Unknown
member.summary: Server does not support this mechanism.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ChangePendedFlags.None
member.summary: No flags were set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ChangePendedFlags.WorkingFolderMappingsUpdated
member.summary: One or more working folders was updated in this call.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.ValidateCheckInOwner
member.summary: Make sure that the identity specified as the checkin owner refers to a valid user

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.SuppressEvent
member.summary: Suppress events for this checkin

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.DeleteShelveset
member.summary: Delete the shelveset after a successful submission into the repository

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.OverrideGatedCheckIn
member.summary: Bypass gated checkin validation for this checkin

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.QueueBuildForGatedCheckIn
member.summary: Automatically queue the build for gated checkin validation if it is possible

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.AllContentUploaded
member.summary: The server will permit a call to CheckIn with a null or empty list of items to check in, (checkin /all) even if there is a change with the edit bit set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.AllowUnchangedContent
member.summary: t=The server will allow items which have a pending edit to be checked in even if the content hasn't changed instead of undoing the change (default)

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.NoAutoResolve
member.summary: Used only on the client. Instructs the client not to try to auto resolve conflicts

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInOptions2.NoConflictsCheckForGatedCheckIn
member.summary: This flag only affects the server's behavior when the server paths being checked in affect a gated build definition. In this case the server will ordinarily call CheckPendingChanges before shelving the workspace and throwing back a GatedCheckinException. If the call to CheckPendingChanges creates conflicts, then no GatedCheckinException will be thrown; instead CheckIn fails and informs the user that they must resolve their conflicts. If this flag is specified, this call to CheckPendingChanges is skipped. This allows the gated checkin shelveset to be created even when the items being checked in are not at latest, for example. The build agent workspace will unshelve the shelveset and attempt to resolve conflicts at that time.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInState.Unknown

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInState.Paging

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.CheckInState.Failed
member.summary: CheckIn() did not throw an exception, but nothing was checked in (e.g. all pending changes undone)

member.summary: The contents of both files are the same for the range of the hunk.

member.summary: The contents of Common and Latest are different for the range of the hunk.

member.summary: Both the Common/Modified and Common/Latest regions of this file are different.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.DiffSegmentType.DiffCommon
member.summary: Modified and Latest regions of this file are identical, but the Common version is different.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeChangeType
member.summary: An enumeration of the possible change types for a merge operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeChangeType.Modified
member.summary: Content from the original sequence has changed in the modified sequence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeChangeType.Latest
member.summary: Content from the original sequence has changed in the latest sequence.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeChangeType.Both
member.summary: Content from the original sequence has changed in both the modified and the latest sequences. The changed content in the modified and latest sequences is identical and non-conflicting.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeChangeType.Conflict
member.summary: Content from the original sequence has changed in both the modified and the latest sequences. The changed content in the modified and latest sequences is conflicting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx
member.summary: The complete set of merge options, this is coverted to an int and sent to the server so we can be backward compatible in future versions

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.None
member.summary: No option

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.ForceMerge
member.summary: Instructs the server to re-merge source versions which have been previously merged

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.Baseless
member.summary: Instructs the server to perform a baseless merge between items

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.NoMerge
member.summary: Instructs the server not to actually pend the merge, but just return a preview of what must be merged

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.AlwaysAcceptMine
member.summary: Instructs the server to discard any changes from the source, keeping only changes from the target.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.Silent
member.summary: Instructs the server to supress any get operations and conflicts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.NoImplicitBaseless
member.summary: Only works prior on TFS 2008, instructs the server not to implicitly baseless merge items with the same relative path from the source root and target root. e.g. $/proj/trunk -> $/proj/branch If a new file is added at $/proj/trunk/a.cs and $/proj/branch/a.cs Setting this option will tell the server not to try to merge the 2 files

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.Conservative
member.summary: Instructs the server to be conservative when declaring merges as conflicts. Available from TFS 2010.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeOptionsEx.NoAutoResolve
member.summary: Used only on the client. Instructs the client not to try to auto resolve conflicts

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary
member.summary: The merge summary information provides the total number of changes in the different change classifications. NOTE: This was copied almost verbatim from the old engine, because we already shipped this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary.TotalBoth
member.summary: Total number of changes only in the modified file and latest file (not in the original).

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary.TotalCommon
member.summary: Total number of changes common to all files.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary.TotalConflicting
member.summary: Total number of changes that conflict.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary.TotalLatest
member.summary: Total number of changes only in the latest file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.MergeSummary.TotalModified
member.summary: Total number of changes only in the modified file.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions
member.summary: Options for the PendChanges Web Service. Will be actually sent across the wire as an integer value, instead of as a serialized Enum.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions.None
member.summary: The client did not specify any options

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions.GetLatestOnCheckout
member.summary: The client requests to synchronize to the latest version of an item on Checkout (PendingEdit). In this case the server will download the latest version of the file to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions.Silent
member.summary: This instructs the server not to return GetOps for the operation. In the case when GetLatestOnCheckout and Silent are enabled, you may still receive a GetOp if you have to GetLatest.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions.ForceCheckOutLocalVersion
member.summary: This instructs the server to force "CheckOut Local Version" behavior. This flag will supercede the GetLatestOnCheckout flag above if both are specified. This flag will supercede the GetLatestOnCheckout team project annotation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendChangesOptions.SuppressItemNotFoundFailures
member.summary: This flag instructs the client not to report any Failures returned by the server of type ItemNotFoundException as NonFatalErrors.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendingChangePropertyVersions
member.summary: The valid versions for the SetPendingChangeProperty method

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendingChangePropertyVersions.NonVersioned
member.summary: When the pending change is checked in, it will be transitioned to a VersionedItem property not associated with a specific version

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.PendingChangePropertyVersions.SpecificVersion
member.summary: When the pending change is checked in, it will be transitioned to a VersionedItem Property associated with the version created in the changeset

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ProxyFlags
member.summary: Flags for proxy records

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ProxyFlags.None
member.summary: No flags specified

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ProxyFlags.SiteDefault
member.summary: THe proxy is a site default

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.ProxyFlags.GlobalDefault
member.summary: The proxy is a global default

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.QueryMergesExtendedOptions
member.summary: Options to pass to the query merges extended method

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.QueryMergesExtendedOptions.None
member.summary: No options specified

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.QueryMergesExtendedOptions.QueryRenames
member.summary: Specifies the query should only query sources of a rename Specifies the query should only query source / targets of a rename The default is to query sources of a merge The default is to query source / targets of a merge

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.QueryMergesExtendedOptions.IncludeDownloadInfo
member.summary: Include download information.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.QueryMergesExtendedOptions.QueryTargetMerges
member.summary: Specifies that the query should query targets for a given source item.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RepositoryFailureCodes
member.summary: Failure codes for version control operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RepositoryFailureCodes.MergeBranchSourceReadPermissionWarning
member.summary: Gets the warning code for missing read permissions when unshelving a shelveset.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RepositoryFailureCodes.QueryShelvedItemsReadPermissionWarning
member.summary: Gets the warning code for missing read permissions when querying shelved items.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RepositoryFailureCodes.UnshelveReadPermissionWarning
member.summary: Gets the warning code for missing read permissions when unshelving a shelveset.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions
member.summary: Enum of rollback options that will be used on the client / server. Marshalled to the server as an integer

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions.None
member.summary: The client did not specify any options

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions.ToVersion
member.summary: Indicates that the client asked for a certain version to be latest In this case the server will download the latest version of the file to the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions.Silent
member.summary: Indicates to the server not to return any Get operations or conflict information

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions.KeepMergeHistory
member.summary: Do not rollback merge history with this rollback operation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.RollbackOptions.NoAutoResolve
member.summary: Used only on the client. Instructs the client not to try to auto resolve conflicts

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures
member.summary: Enum which has the features supported by either the client or server

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.None
member.summary: None of the features in this enum are supported.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.GetLatestOnCheckout
member.summary: The client supports optionally synchronizing to the latest version of an item on Checkout (PendingEdit). If this flag is set but GetLatestOnCheckout is not set in PendChangesOptions, then the client will synchronize only if the team project has the GetLatestOnCheckout setting on.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.OneLevelMapping
member.summary: This means that the server / client supports one level mappings

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.Destroy
member.summary: The destroy feature is available on the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.CreateBranch
member.summary: The ability to create a committed branch on the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.GetChangesForChangeset
member.summary: The ability to page changes in a changeset.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.ProxySuite
member.summary: This represents the suite of proxy services: AddProxy(), DeleteProxy(), QueryProxies(),

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.LocalVersions
member.summary: This represents the ability to query local version information from the server

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.BatchedCheckins
member.summary: This represents the ability to page pending changes down from the server, and queue up pending changes for checkin, before committing them.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.WorkspacePermissions
member.summary: The server supports workspace permissions

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.CheckinDates
member.summary: The server supports the ability to set checkin dates

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.SupportedFeatures.All
member.summary: This is a combination of all the features which are supported. Subject to change across releases. You can send this value (from client object model to server, or from server to client object model) and mask with it, but you should not test for equality against it.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath
member.summary: A utility class for manipulating version control items specifications. It contains routines for parsing, formatting, validating, and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CheckForIllegalDollarInPath(System.String)
member.summary: This method throws an InvalidPathException if there is a dollar sign ('$') that follows a path separator ('/'), because no part of a path can start with a dollar sign.
member.param: The path to check (path must already be canonicalized).

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Combine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return a fully qualified and canonicalized path constructed from parent and relative. If relative is already a fully qualified path, just return a canonicalized copy of relative. If relative is not fully qualified, return the path that results from appending relative to parent and canonicalizing the result. It is assumed that parent is already canonicalized.
member.param: The parent path to append relative to (if relative is not fully qualified).
The potentially partial path to qualify relative to parent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Combine(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given a base local path, base server path and target local path compute the target server path. This is completed by generating the relative path for the local paths, converting that to a server relative path and combining it with the base server path. Note: This method will throw an invalid path exception if it cannot generate the target server path. Possible reasons for this include the following: 1) local paths are on different drives and are not relative. 2) combining the calculated relative path with the base server path causes a "negative folder depth" (that is directory above root, $/). Examples: Combine(@"c:\myproj\abc\xyz", @"c:\myproj\abc\blech", @"$/abc") -> @"$/blech" Combine(@"c:\myproj\abc\xyz", @"c:\myproj\abc\xyz\x", @"$/xyz") -> @"$/xyz/x" Combine(@"c:\myproj\abc\xyz", @"c:\yourproj\abc\xyz\x", @"$/xyz") -> @"InvalidPathException" Combine(@"c:\myproj\abc\xyz", @"c:\yourproj\abc\xyz", @"$/myproj/abc/xyz") -> @"$/yourproj/abc/xyz"

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Compare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control item paths.
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Compare(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control item paths.
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater and less than 0 if the second is greater.
member.param: Length of the first item to compare.
Length of the second item to compare.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CompareCaseSensitive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control item paths in a case-insensitive manner on every part of the path except for the last item in the path. The last item in the path is compared in a case-sensitive manner.
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CompareTopDown(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control paths and return their relative ordering. This is like Compare except that it sorts grandchildren after children.
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CompareTopDownUI(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control paths and returns their relative ordering for display (culture and case insensitive). This is like Compare except that it sorts grandchildren after children.
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CompareUI(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control item paths for display (culture-sensitive and case-insensitive).
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.CompareUI(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compare two Version Control item paths for display (culture-sensitive and case-insensitive).
member.returns: 0 if they are equal, greater than 0 if the first is greater, less than 0 if the second is greater.
member.param: Length of the first item to compare.
Length of the second item to compare.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.DepthFirstTreeComparer
member.summary: This comparer can be used to sort version control paths depth-first, just like a tree traversal.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Equals(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compare two file specs for equality.
member.returns: Return true if the items match.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.EqualsCaseSensitive(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks two file paths for equality. Returns whether they are equal in a case-insensitive manner on every part of the path except for the last item in the path. The last item in the path is compared in a case-sensitive manner.
member.returns: True if and only if they are equal in a case-sensitive comparison.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.FullPathComparer
member.summary: Return a string comparer for fully-specified server paths.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetCommonParent(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given two server paths, return the farthest item from $/ that parents both items. If one of the two paths is null, the other will be returned. If both paths are null, an ArgumentNullException is thrown.
member.returns: The farthest item from $/ that parents both path1 and path2.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Get the file name extension from a version control spec.
member.returns: The extension, which does not contain the period.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Return the last path component from a canonicalized path. For example, passing "$/abc/xyz" would return "xyz". Passing "$/" will return "".

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFolderDepth(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the number of levels of path elements in this spec.$/ will return 0 $/abc will return 1 $/abc/xyz will return 2, and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFolderDepth(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of levels of path elements in this spec up to the maximum depth.$/ will return 0 $/abc will return 1 $/abc/xyz will return 2, and so on.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFolderName(System.String)
member.summary: Get the parent folder for the specified canonicalized path. If "$/" is passed, "$/" is returned as the parent.
member.param: Path to get the parent folder for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Canonicalize the specified items specification and return the string. This will do things such as remove ..'s, convert \ to /, and so on. It throws an InvalidPathException if the item is the empty string, contains invalid characters including an embedded dollar sign (wildcard characters are not considered invalid in this check), or is too long.
member.returns: Canonical string form of the item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetFullPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Canonicalize the specified items specification and return the string. This will do things such as remove ..'s, convert \ to /, and so on. It throws an InvalidPathException if the item is the empty string, contains invalid characters including an embedded dollar sign (wildcard characters are not considered invalid in this check), or is too long.
member.returns: Canonical string form of the item.
member.param: boolean flag whether to validate version control reserved characters or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetRelativeStartIndex(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given a path and folder, return the index of the substring in path relative to the folder. If the path is not under the folder then 0 is returned (meaning the entire path). MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src") -> 6 MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/specs") -> 0 MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src/proj") -> 0
member.returns: Index of relative path part in path.
member.param: Folder to make it relative to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetTeamProject(System.String)
member.summary: Return the top level "team project" folder given a server item.
member.returns: The top level project from the version control spec.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.GetTeamProjectName(System.String)
member.summary: Return the top level "team project" given a server item.
member.returns: The top level project from the version control spec.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsCanonicalizedPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if the path is canonicalized. The path must not contain a $ at the start of a path part, or any invalid characters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsImmediateChild(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if item is an immediate child of parent.
member.returns: true if item is an immediate child of parent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsServerItem(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified string appears to be a server item (instead of a local item). The path is not required to be canonicalized. All server item paths are absolute.
member.returns: true if the string is a server item.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsSubItem(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return true if the item is equal to or is under (in the heirarchy) parent.
member.returns: True if item is equal or under parent.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsTeamProject(System.String)
member.summary: Return whether the passed server item is a team project ($/abc, $/def, not $/abc/efg nor $/)
member.returns: Whether the item is a team project.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsValidFolderName(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Checks if the specified folder name is valid. By folder name, we are referring to a single folder, not the full path. Wild cards are not allowed here. For example, a folder name in the full path below could be A, B, or C $/A/B/C/file.txt
member.returns: True if the folder name is valid.
member.param: The error string if the folder name is invalid; otherwise, null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsValidPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path is valid; false otherwise.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.IsWildcard(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if the last component of the specified path contains a wildcard character. The path may be fully qualified.
member.returns: True if the path contains a wildcard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.MakeRelative(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Given a path and folder, return the path relative to the folder. If the path is not under the folder the path is returned unmodified. Both path and folder are assumed to be in canonical form. Examples: MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src") -> @"project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/specs") -> @"$/src/project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src/proj") -> @"$/src/project/abc.cpp"
member.param: Folder to make it relative to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.MakeRelative(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given a path and folder, return the path relative to the folder. If the path is not under the folder and the recursive parameter is false then path is returned unmodified. Otherwise, the method iteratively each parent directory in the specified folder and tries to make item relative. Both path and folder are assumed to be in canonical form. Examples: MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src",false) -> @"project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/specs",false) -> @"$/src/project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src/proj",false) -> @"$/src/project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src", true) -> @"project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/specs", true) -> @"../src/project/abc.cpp" MakeRelative(@"$/src/project/abc.cpp", @"$/src/proj", true) -> @"../project/abc.cpp"
member.param: Folder to make it relative to.
Flag to indicate if method should relativize to folder's parents.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Match(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Compare an item to see whether it matches a folder and a name that may be a wildcard. If recursive is true then any matching item under the matchFolder will match. Wildcard matching is performed by using the NT file system matching rules.
member.returns: true if the item matches, false otherwise.
member.param: Whether or not the match occurs recursively.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.MatchFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Match just the final component of the specified item to the specified wildcard.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.Parse(System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parse a canonicalized item spec into a parent folder and the last path component. If "$/" is passed, the parent is "$/" and the name is "".
member.param: The item to parse into a parent path and a name.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.PrependRootIfNeeded(System.String)
member.summary: Utility method to prepend the root ($/) to a folder - most useful for getting the folder of a team project if you only have his name.
member.param: Folder path that may start with $/ already.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.StringComparer
member.summary: This is a property for comparison of server paths in instances like a Dictionary hash.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionControlPath.ValidatePath(System.String)
member.summary: Validate the server path. Wildcards are not allowed. Exception is thrown if invalid.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionedItemPermissions
member.summary: Defines the permission bitmasks used in the database for versioned items (files/folders) Used in tblPermission.GrantedPermission and tblPermission.RevokedPermission

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionedItemPermissions.Merge
member.summary: Determines whether a given user has permissions to perform merge operations.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VersionedItemPermissions.ManageBranch
member.summary: Determines whether a given user has permissions to manage branch objects. manage includes the following operations: create a branch object, update branch object metadata, destroy branch objects. NOTE THAT THIS PERMISSION DOES NOT APPLY TO REGULAR BRANCHES.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.VssOutputType
member.summary: Supported diff output types from Visual Source Safe.NOTE: This was copied almost verbatim from the old engine, because we already shipped this enum.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceLocation
member.summary: Indicates the location where data (pending changes, local versions) for this workspace are stored.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceLocation.Server
member.summary: Indicates a server-side (traditional) workspace, backward compatible with TFS 2005-2010.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceLocation.Local
member.summary: Indicates a local workspace, with pending changes and local version data stored on the client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceOptions.SetFileTimeToCheckin
member.summary: Sets the last modified time for newly downloaded files to checkin time.

member.name: T:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec
member.summary: A utility class for manipulating Hatteras workspace specifications. It contains routines for parsing, formatting, validating, and so on

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.Combine(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the qualified workspace name from the separate workspace and owner parts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.Combine(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds the fully qualified workspace name with owner disambiguation from the separate workspace and owner parts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.IsLegalName(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see whether the workspace name consists only of valid characters and is less than the maximum length and does not contain a workspace separator.
member.returns: true if the workspace name is valid; false otherwise

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.OwnerDisambiguationSeparatorEnd
member.summary: Returns the end string for the owner disambiguation separator.

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.OwnerDisambiguationSeparatorStart
member.summary: Returns the start string for the owner disambiguation separator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.Parse(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parse a workspace spec of the form Workspace;user and return the two parts. If the user name is not specified (or fully qualified) in the workspace specification, use information from the defaultUser arguments. NOTE: This method may qualified username (e.g. it lacked the domain\ prefix), this routine does not attempt to provide the missing pieces. The caller is reponsible for doing this.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.Parse(System.String,System.String,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parse a workspace spec of the form Workspace;user and return the two parts. If the user name is not specified (or fully qualified) in the workspace specification, use information from the defaultUser argument. NOTE: This method may qualified username (e.g. it lacked the domain\ prefix), this routine does not attempt to provide the missing pieces. The caller is reponsible for doing this.

member.name: M:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.SanitizeProposedName(System.String)
member.summary: Given a proposed name for a shelveset or workspace, truncates it at the maximum length for shelveset and workspace names, and removes invalid characters. Name validation is enforced by the server. The sanitization process for cleaning up a name is current as of the version of this object model.While unlikely, it is possible that if this method is used with a future version of esprtfs, that the name generated may not be valid due to a change in the rules for workspace and shelveset names.
member.returns: A sanitized name for the workspace or shelveset
member.param: Proposed name for the workspace or shelveset

member.name: P:Microsoft.TeamFoundation.VersionControl.Common.WorkspaceSpec.Separator
member.summary: Returns the separator character for WorkspaceSpec.
